Roberts, Human Sciences Research Council</AuthEnty>         <othId>Michael Noble</othId>       </rspStmt>       <prodStmt>         <copyright>David McLennan, University of Oxford</copyright>         <copyright>Benjamin J. Roberts, Human Sciences Research Council</copyright>         <fundAg>ESRC</fundAg>         <grantNo>ES/I034889/1</grantNo>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <depositr>David McLennan, University of Oxford</depositr>         <depositr>Benjamin J. Roberts, Human Sciences Research Council</depositr>         <distDate date="2014-11-19T00:00:00Z">19 November 2014</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2015-01-07T00:00:00Z">Rvs35</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-851573" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>INEQUALITY</keyword>         <keyword>POVERTY</keyword>         <keyword>DEPRIVATION</keyword>         <keyword>SPATIAL</keyword>         <keyword>GEOGRAPHICAL</keyword>         <keyword>ATTITUDES</keyword>         <keyword>SOCIAL</keyword>         <keyword>SOUTH AFRICA</keyword>         <keyword>2014</keyword>         <topcClas>Regular opinion polls</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social welfare policy and systems</topcClas>         <topcClas>Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This dataset consists of the individual-level survey data (from the South African Social Attitudes Survey 2009) plus linked area-level data concerning exposure to socio-economic inequality and neighbourhood poverty rates. These data have been anonymised by rounding the area-level variables and replacing the area-level identifier codes with new unique identifiers to ensure respondent confidentiality. </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="2001-01-01T00:00:00Z">01 January 2001</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2009-12-31T00:00:00Z">31 December 2009</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="2011-10-01T00:00:00Z">01 October 2011</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2014-04-30T00:00:00Z">30 April 2014</collDate>         <nation>South Africa</nation>         <geogCover>South Africa</geogCover>         <geogUnit>Other</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>individuals</anlyUnit>         <dataKind>Alpha-numeric</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <collMode>The individual-level survey respondent data were taken from the 2009 round of the South African Social Attitudes Survey (please see http://www.hsrc.ac.za/en/departments/sasas for more details). The linked area-level data on 'exposure to inequality' were constructed as part of this particular research project (please see http://www.casasp.ox.ac.uk/esrc_inequality.html for more details) while the neighbourhood poverty rate variable was taken from the South African Index of Multiple Deprivation 2001 at Datazone level (please see http://www.casasp.ox.ac.uk/indices.html#SAIMD01 for more details)</collMode>         <sources />       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <contact><a href="mailto:david.mclennan@spi.ox.ac.uk">David McLennan, University of Oxford</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat />   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
